title: Kuma's Sacrifice Was for Bonney
theory: Fans theorized that Bartholomew Kuma's willing transformation into a mindless Pacifista was motivated by a deal to save someone he cared about, likely Jewelry Bonney. The theory suggested that Vegapunk offered to cure Bonney's Sapphire Scale Disease in exchange for Kuma becoming the Pacifista prototype.
author: One Piece Community
evidence: Doflamingo reveals Kuma voluntarily underwent the transformation
Kuma's kind nature suggests he would sacrifice himself for others
Later confirmed in the manga that Kuma made a deal with Vegapunk to save Bonney

title: Kuma Can Be Restored
theory: Despite Doflamingo's claim that 'Kuma is dead,' fans theorized that Kuma's consciousness or memories might be recoverable through Vegapunk's technology or some other means, and that he would eventually be restored to help the Revolutionary Army.
author: One Piece Community
evidence: Vegapunk's scientific genius suggests possibilities for restoration
Kuma's past kindness toward the Straw Hats implies unfinished business
Later developments in the manga show attempts to preserve/restore Kuma's memories

title: Hancock Will Lose Her Warlord Status
theory: After Hancock openly attacked Smoker to protect Luffy in Episode 468, fans theorized that she would lose her Warlord position and that Amazon Lily would lose its protection from the World Government as a consequence.
author: One Piece Community
evidence: Smoker directly questions if she's resigning from the Shichibukai
Her actions clearly violate her duties as a Warlord
Later confirmed when the Warlord system is abolished

title: Vegapunk Has a Hidden Agenda
theory: Fans speculated that Dr. Vegapunk, despite working for the World Government, might have his own agenda or sympathies toward the Revolutionary Army, given his connection to both Kuma (a Revolutionary) and the morally questionable nature of the Pacifista program.
author: One Piece Community
evidence: Kuma's willingness to undergo transformation suggests trust in Vegapunk
The relationship between Kuma and Vegapunk implied deeper connections
Later revealed that Vegapunk has sympathies toward the Revolutionary Army and helped Dragon
